src/compile-cache.js
CompileCache
description:
CompileCache manages getting and setting entries for a single compiler; each
in-use compiler will have an instance of this class, usually created via
{@link createFromCompiler}. 

You usually will not use this class directly, it is an implementation class 
for {@link CompileHost}.

name: constructor
description: Creates an instance, usually used for testing only.

params.name: cachePath
params.description: The root directory to use as a cache path

params.name: fileChangeCache
params.description:
A file-change cache that is 
                                            optionally pre-loaded.

name: createFromCompiler
description:
Creates a CompileCache from a class compatible with the CompilerBase 
interface. This method uses the compiler name / version / options to 
generate a unique directory name for cached results

params.name: cachePath
params.description:
The root path to use for the cache, a directory
                            representing the hash of the compiler parameters
                            will be created here.

params.name: compiler
params.description:
The compiler to use for version / option
                                 information.

params.name: fileChangeCache
params.description:
A file-change cache that is 
                                            optionally pre-loaded.

name: get
description: Returns a file's compiled contents from the cache.

params.name: filePath
params.description:
The path to the file. FileChangedCache will look
                           up the hash and use that as the key in the cache.

properties.name: hashInfo
properties.description: The hash information returned from getHashForPath

properties.name: code
properties.description: The source code if the file was a text file

properties.name: binaryData
properties.description: The file if it was a binary file

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: The MIME type saved in the cache.

properties.name: dependentFiles
properties.description:
The dependent files returned from 
                                     compiling the file, if any.

return.description: An object with all kinds of information

name: save
description: Saves a compiled result to cache

params.name: hashInfo
params.description: The hash information returned from getHashForPath

params.name: codeOrBinaryData
params.description:
The file's contents, either as
                                             a string or a Buffer.

params.name: mimeType
params.description: The MIME type returned by the compiler.

params.name: dependentFiles
params.description:
The list of dependent files returned by
                                   the compiler.

name: getOrFetch
description:
Attempts to first get a key via {@link get}, then if it fails, call a method
to retrieve the contents, then save the result to cache.

The fetcher parameter is expected to have the signature:

Object fetcher(filePath : string, hashInfo : Object);

hashInfo is a value returned from getHashForPath
The return value of fetcher must be an Object with the properties:

mimeType - the MIME type of the data to save
code (optional) - the source code as a string, if file is text
binaryData (optional) - the file contents as a Buffer, if file is binary
dependentFiles - the dependent files returned by the compiler.

params.name: filePath
params.description:
The path to the file. FileChangedCache will look
                           up the hash and use that as the key in the cache.

params.name: fetcher
params.description: A method which conforms to the description above.

return.description:
An Object which has the same fields as the 
                           {@link get} method return result.

name: getSync
description: Returns a file's compiled contents from the cache.

params.name: filePath
params.description:
The path to the file. FileChangedCache will look

params.name: codeOrBinaryData

The file's contents, either as
                                             a string or a Buffer.

params.name: mimeType

params.name: dependentFiles
params.description:
The list of dependent files returned by

name: getOrFetchSync
description:
Attempts to first get a key via {@link get}, then if it fails, call a method
to retrieve the contents, then save the result to cache.

The fetcher parameter is expected to have the signature:

Object fetcher(filePath : string, hashInfo : Object);

hashInfo is a value returned from getHashForPath
The return value of fetcher must be an Object with the properties:

mimeType - the MIME type of the data to save
code (optional) - the source code as a string, if file is text
binaryData (optional) - the file contents as a Buffer, if file is binary
dependentFiles - the dependent files returned by the compiler.

params.name: filePath

name: shouldPassthrough
description:
Returns whether a file should not be compiled. Note that this doesn't 
necessarily mean it won't end up in the cache, only that its contents are
saved verbatim instead of trying to find an appropriate compiler.

params.name: hashInfo
params.description: The hash information returned from getHashForPath

return.description: True if a file should be ignored

name: src/compiler-host.js
CompilerHost
description:
This class is the top-level class that encapsulates all of the logic of 
compiling and caching application code. If you're looking for a "Main class",
this is it.

This class can be created directly but it is usually created via the methods
in config-parser, which will among other things, set up the compiler options
given a project root.

CompilerHost is also the top-level class that knows how to serialize all of the
information necessary to recreate itself, either as a development host (i.e.
will allow cache misses and actual compilation), or as a read-only version of
itself for production.

name: constructor

params.name: rootCacheDir
params.description: The root directory to use for the cache

params.name: compilers
params.description:
an Object whose keys are input MIME types and
                            whose values are instances of CompilerBase. Create
                            this via the {@link createCompilers} method in
                            config-parser.

params.name: fileChangeCache
params.description:
A file-change cache that is 
                                            optionally pre-loaded.

params.name: readOnlyMode
params.description:
If True, cache misses will fail and 
                                compilation will not be attempted.

params.name: fallbackCompiler
params.description:
(optional)  When a file is compiled
                                        which doesn't have a matching compiler,
                                        this compiler will be used instead. If
                                        null, will fail compilation. A good
                                        alternate fallback is the compiler for
                                        'text/plain', which is guaranteed to be
                                        present.

name: init
description:
Initialize electron-compile and set it up, either for development or 
production use. This is almost always the only method you need to use in order
to use electron-compile.

params.name: appRoot
params.description:
The top-level directory for your application (i.e.
                          the one which has your package.json).

params.name: mainModule
params.description:
The module to require in, relative to the module
                             calling init, that will start your app. Write this 
                             as if you were writing a require call from here.

params.name: productionMode
params.description:
If explicitly True/False, will set read-only
                                mode to be disabled/enabled. If not, we'll
                                guess based on the presence of a production
                                cache.

usually called by {@link createCompilerHostFromProjectRoot}.

Creates a configured {@link CompilerHost} instance from the project root

default locations for Babel configuration info. If neither are found, defaults
to standard settings

params.name: rootDir
params.description:
The root application directory (i.e. the directory
                          that has the app's package.json)

params.name: rootCacheDir
params.description: (optional)  The directory to use as a cache.

name: calculateDefaultCompileCacheDirectory
description:
Returns what electron-compile would use as a default rootCacheDir. Usually only
used for debugging purposes

return.description:
A path that may or may not exist where electron-compile would
                  set up a development mode cache.

name: getDefaultConfiguration
description: Returns the default .configrc if no configuration information can be found.

return.description: A list of default config settings for electron-compiler.

name: createCompilers
description:
Allows you to create new instances of all compilers that are supported by 
electron-compile and use them directly. Currently supports Babel, CoffeeScript, 
TypeScript, LESS, and Jade.

return.description:
An Object whose Keys are MIME types, and whose values 
are instances of @{link CompilerBase}.

name: src/file-change-cache.js
FileChangedCache
description:
This class caches information about files and determines whether they have
changed contents or not. Most importantly, this class caches the hash of seen
files so that at development time, we don't have to recalculate them constantly.

This class is also the core of how electron-compile runs quickly in production
mode - after precompilation, the cache is serialized along with the rest of the
data in {@link CompilerHost}, so that when we load the app in production mode,
we don't end up calculating hashes of file content at all, only using the contents
of this cache.

name: loadFromData
description:
Allows you to create a FileChangedCache from serialized data saved from 
{@link getSavedData}.

params.name: data
params.description: Saved data from getSavedData.

params.description:

                          the one which has your package.json).

params.name: failOnCacheMiss
params.description: (optional)  If True, cache misses will throw.

properties.name: code

(optional)  The string that was read if the file

metadata information so that {@link CompileCache} et al are able to recreate the
hash without having two separate code paths.
